intro: Pedicularis pygmaea subsp. pygmaea, commonly known as the dwarf monkeyflower, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and yellow. The plant grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, often in mountainous areas. It has a low-growing habit with slender stems and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
